DESCRIPTION: [Nazi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Germany "Nazi Germany") [Einsatzgruppen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Einsatzgruppen "Einsatzgruppen") killed the [Jewish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Jews_in_Russia_and_the_Soviet_Union "History of the Jews in Russia and the Soviet Union") population of [Kyiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyiv "Kyiv").

NAME: [Kragujevac massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kragujevac_massacre "Kragujevac massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Nazi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi "Nazi") soldiers massacred Serb and Roma hostages in retaliation for attacks on the occupying forces.

NAME: [Odessa massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1941_Odessa_massacre "1941 Odessa massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Romanian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania "Romania") and German troops, supported by local authorities, massacred Jews in [Odessa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odessa "Odessa") and the surrounding towns in [Transnistria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transnistria_(World_War_II) "Transnistria (World War II)"). The Romanians blamed Jews and communists for the detonation of a mine that was placed by Red Army sappers prior to their defeat.

NAME: [Ninth Fort massacres of November 1941](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninth_Fort_massacres_of_November_1941 "Ninth Fort massacres of November 1941")
DESCRIPTION: The first systematic mass killings of German Jews during the [Holocaust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holocaust "Holocaust").

NAME: [Rumbula massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rumbula_massacre "Rumbula massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 25,000 Jews were killed in Rumbula Forest, near Riga, Latvia, by the Nazis.

NAME: [Arakan massacres in 1942](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arakan_massacres_in_1942 "Arakan massacres in 1942")
DESCRIPTION: After local British forces retreated, violence erupted between pro-Japanese [Rakhine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rakhine_people "Rakhine people") [Buddhists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddhism "Buddhism") and pro-British [Rohingya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rohingya_people "Rohingya people") [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam "Islam") as a result of the [power vacuum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_vacuum "Power vacuum").

NAME: [Laha massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laha_massacre "Laha massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Japanese killed surrendered Australian soldiers.

NAME: [First Dzyatlava massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dzyatlava_massacre "Dzyatlava massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Around 1,200 Jews were marched out of the [Dzyatlava Ghetto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dzyatlava_Ghetto "Dzyatlava Ghetto") into the Kurpiesze (Kurpyash) forest and shot by [Order Police battalions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_Police_battalions "Order Police battalions"), aided by members of the [Lithuanian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lithuanian_Auxiliary_Police_Battalions "Lithuanian Auxiliary Police Battalions") and [Belarusian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byelorussian_Auxiliary_Police "Byelorussian Auxiliary Police") auxiliary police forces.

LOCATION: [Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protectorate_of_Bohemia_and_Moravia "Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia")
NAME: [Lidice massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lidice_massacre "Lidice massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Nazis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi "Nazi") killed 192 men, and sent the women and children to [Nazi concentration camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_concentration_camps "Nazi concentration camps") where many died.

NAME: [Second Dzyatlava massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dzyatlava_massacre "Dzyatlava massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Liquidation of the [Dzyatlava Ghetto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dzyatlava_Ghetto "Dzyatlava Ghetto"). Thousands of Jews were taken to mass graves on the southern outskirts of town and shot so that they fell in them.

NAME: [Khatyn massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khatyn_massacre "Khatyn massacre")
DESCRIPTION: In retaliation for a [Soviet partisan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_partisans "Soviet partisans") attack, the [Dirlewanger Brigade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirlewanger_Brigade "Dirlewanger Brigade") and [Schutzmannschaft Battalion 118](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schutzmannschaft_Battalion_118 "Schutzmannschaft Battalion 118") of the [Ukrainian Auxiliary Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Auxiliary_Police "Ukrainian Auxiliary Police") slaughter almost the entire population of Khatyn.

NAME: [Naliboki massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naliboki_massacre "Naliboki massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Soviet partisans killed 129 Polish villagers.

NAME: [Dominopol massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominopol_massacre "Dominopol massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Polish villagers were attacked by a [death squad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_squad "Death squad") of the [Ukrainian Insurgent Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Insurgent_Army "Ukrainian Insurgent Army") aided by local Ukrainian peasants.

NAME: [Szczurowa massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Szczurowa_massacre "Szczurowa massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 93 [Romani people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romani_people "Romani people") were rounded up and murdered in the village cemetery by Nazi occupiers.

NAME: [Massacre of the Acqui Division](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massacre_of_the_Acqui_Division "Massacre of the Acqui Division")
DESCRIPTION: [Wehrmacht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wehrmacht "Wehrmacht") troops executed 5,155 POWs from the Italian [33 Infantry Division Acqui](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/33_Infantry_Division_Acqui "33 Infantry Division Acqui") after the latter refused to hand over their weapons and [resisted](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Resistance "Italian Resistance"). A further 3,000 Italian POWs drowned at sea on transports that sank after hitting [mines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_mine "Sea mine").

NAME: [Wake Island massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Wake_Island#War_crimes "Battle of Wake Island")
DESCRIPTION: Japanese forces under Rear Admiral [Shigematsu Sakaibara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigematsu_Sakaibara "Shigematsu Sakaibara") massacred the remaining 98 U.S. civilians in fear of the anticipation U.S. invasion of Wake Island two days after a U.S. air raid on the island.

NAME: [Massacre of Kalavryta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massacre_of_Kalavryta "Massacre of Kalavryta")
DESCRIPTION: The extermination of the male population and the subsequent total destruction of the town of [Kalavryta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalavryta "Kalavryta"), in Greece, by [a Jäger division](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/117th_J%C3%A4ger_Division_(Wehrmacht) "117th Jäger Division (Wehrmacht)") that was part of the German occupying forces during World War II on 13 December 1943. It is the most serious case of war crimes committed during the [Axis occupation of Greece during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axis_occupation_of_Greece_during_World_War_II "Axis occupation of Greece during World War II").

NAME: [Foibe massacres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foibe_massacres "Foibe massacres")
DESCRIPTION: Multiple massacres against Italian civilians by [Yugoslav Partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslav_Partisans "Yugoslav Partisans").

NAME: [Khaibakh massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khaibakh_massacre "Khaibakh massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Khaibakh massacre refers to a report of mass execution of the ethnically Chechen population of the aul of Khaibakh, in the mountainous part of Chechnya by Soviet forces under NKVD Colonel Mikhail Gveshiani during the [Deportation of the Chechens and Ingush](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deportation_of_the_Chechens_and_Ingush "Deportation of the Chechens and Ingush").

NAME: [Koniuchy massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koniuchy_massacre "Koniuchy massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Soviet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_partisans "Soviet partisans") and [Jewish partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jewish_partisans "Jewish partisans") murdered Lithuanian civilians, along with burning down their houses and slaughtering their livestock.

NAME: [Huta Pieniacka massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huta_Pieniacka_massacre "Huta Pieniacka massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Polish civilians were murdered by members of the [14th SS Volunteer Division "Galizien"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_Waffen_Grenadier_Division_of_the_SS_(1st_Galician) "14th Waffen Grenadier Division of the SS (1st Galician)") accompanied by a paramilitary unit of Ukrainian nationalists (though some Ukrainian historians put the blame on [SS police regiments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_SS_and_police_commands "List of SS and police commands") instead).

NAME: [Ardeatine massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ardeatine_massacre "Ardeatine massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Mass killing carried out by German occupation troops as a reprisal for a [partisan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Partisan_(military) "Partisan (military)") attack conducted on the previous day in central Rome against the [SS Police Regiment Bozen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Police_Regiment_Bozen "SS Police Regiment Bozen").

NAME: [Ascq massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ascq_massacre "Ascq massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The [Waffen-SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffen-SS "Waffen-SS") killed 86 men after a bomb attack in the [Gare d'Ascq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gare_d%27Ascq "Gare d'Ascq").

NAME: [Oradour-sur-Glane massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oradour-sur-Glane_massacre "Oradour-sur-Glane massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The [Waffen-SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffen-SS "Waffen-SS") killed 642 men, women and children without giving any specific reasons for their actions.

NAME: [Distomo massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distomo_massacre "Distomo massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Nazi war crime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_war_crime "Nazi war crime") perpetrated by members of the [Waffen-SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffen-SS "Waffen-SS") in the village of [Distomo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distomo "Distomo"), Greece, during the [Axis occupation of Greece during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axis_occupation_of_Greece_during_World_War_II "Axis occupation of Greece during World War II").

NAME: [Wola massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wola_massacre "Wola massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Special groups of [SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS "SS") and German soldiers of the [Wehrmacht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wehrmacht "Wehrmacht") went from house to house in [Warsaw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw "Warsaw") district [Wola](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wola "Wola"), rounding-up and shooting all inhabitants.

NAME: [Sant'Anna di Stazzema massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sant%27Anna_di_Stazzema_massacre "Sant'Anna di Stazzema massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Retreating [SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS "SS")-men of the II [Battalion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battalion "Battalion") of SS-[Panzergrenadier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzergrenadier "Panzergrenadier")-[Regiment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regiment "Regiment") 35 of [16th SS Panzergrenadier Division *Reichsführer-SS*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/16th_SS_Panzergrenadier_Division_Reichsf%C3%BChrer-SS "16th SS Panzergrenadier Division Reichsführer-SS"), rounded up 560 villagers and refugees-mostly women, children and older men-shot them and then burned their bodies.

NAME: [Ochota massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ochota_massacre "Ochota massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Mass murders of citizens of Warsaw district [Ochota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ochota "Ochota") in August 1944, committed by [Waffen-SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffen-SS "Waffen-SS"), specifically the [S.S. Sturmbrigade R.O.N.A.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/29th_Waffen_Grenadier_Division_of_the_SS_%22RONA%22_(1st_Russian) "29th Waffen Grenadier Division of the SS "RONA" (1st Russian)") commanded by [Bronislav Kaminski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bronislav_Kaminski "Bronislav Kaminski").

NAME: [Rüsselsheim massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R%C3%BCsselsheim_massacre "Rüsselsheim massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The townspeople of Rüsselsheim killed six American POWs who were walking through the bombed-out town while escorted by two German guards.

NAME: [Marzabotto massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marzabotto_massacre "Marzabotto massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The [SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schutzstaffel "Schutzstaffel") killed Italian civilians in reprisal for support given to the [resistance movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_resistance_movement "Italian resistance movement").

NAME: [Malmedy massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malmedy_massacre "Malmedy massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Nazi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi "Nazi") [Waffen-SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffen-SS "Waffen-SS") soldiers shot American POWs (43 escaped).

NAME: [Chenogne massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chenogne_massacre "Chenogne massacre")
DESCRIPTION: German prisoners of war were shot by American soldiers in an unauthorized retaliation for the [Malmedy Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malmedy_Massacre "Malmedy Massacre").

NAME: [Manila massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manila_massacre "Manila massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Japanese occupying forces massacred an estimated 100,000 [Filipino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Filipino_people "Filipino people") civilians during the [Battle of Manila](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Manila_(1945) "Battle of Manila (1945)").

NAME: [Pawłokoma massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paw%C5%82okoma_massacre "Pawłokoma massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Members of the Polish [Home Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_Army "Home Army"), aided by Poles living in nearby villages, massacred ethnic Ukrainians.

NAME: [Celle massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celler_Hasenjagd "Celler Hasenjagd")
DESCRIPTION: Massacre of concentration camp inmates that took place in Celle at the end of the Second World War.

NAME: [Bleiburg massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bleiburg_massacre "Bleiburg massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Fleeing Croatian soldiers, members of the [Chetnik movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chetniks "Chetniks") and [Slovene Home Guard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovene_Home_Guard "Slovene Home Guard") associated with the fascist [Ustaše](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usta%C5%A1e "Ustaše") Regime of Croatia were apprehended by [Yugoslav Partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslav_Partisans "Yugoslav Partisans") at the Austrian border. Among those killed were an unknown number of civilians.

NAME: [Sétif massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%A9tif_massacre "Sétif massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Muslim villages were bombed by French aircraft and the cruiser [Duguay-Trouin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_cruiser_Duguay-Trouin_(1923) "French cruiser Duguay-Trouin (1923)") standing off the coast, in the Gulf of Bougie, shelled Kerrata. [Pied noir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pied-Noir "Pied-Noir") vigilantes lynched prisoners taken from local gaols or randomly shot Muslims

NAME: [Utah prisoner of war massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utah_prisoner_of_war_massacre "Utah prisoner of war massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Nine German prisoners of war are killed and 19 were wounded when, at midnight, an American soldier named Clarence V. Bertucci climbed a guard tower and fired at the tents of the sleeping prisoners. By the time his fifteen-second rampage was stopped, six of the POWs were already dead, and three more would later die of their wounds.

NAME: [Ústí massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9Ast%C3%AD_massacre "Ústí massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Ústí massacre (Czech: Ústecký masakr, German: Massaker von Aussig) was a lynching of ethnic Germans in Ústí nad Labem (German: Aussig an der Elbe), a largely ethnic German city in northern Bohemia ("Sudetenland") shortly after the end of the World War II, on July 31, 1945.

NAME: [February 28 Incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_28_Incident "February 28 Incident") (February 28 massacre)
DESCRIPTION: It was an anti-government uprising in Taiwan, and was violently suppressed by the [Kuomintang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuomintang "Kuomintang") government.

NAME: [Portella della Ginestra massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portella_della_Ginestra_massacre "Portella della Ginestra massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 11 people were killed and 27 wounded during [May Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/May_Day "May Day") celebrations in Sicily on May 1, 1947, in the municipality of [Piana degli Albanesi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piana_degli_Albanesi "Piana degli Albanesi"), by the bandit and separatist leader [Salvatore Giuliano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvatore_Giuliano "Salvatore Giuliano") and his band.

LOCATION: [Balongsari](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Balongsari,_West-Java&action=edit&redlink=1 "Balongsari, West-Java (page does not exist)"), [Karawang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karawang_Regency "Karawang Regency"), [West Java](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Java "West Java"), Indonesia
NAME: [Rawagede massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rawagede_massacre "Rawagede massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Almost all men in the Indonesian village of Rawagede (modern-day Balongsari) were killed in retaliation by the [KNIL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Netherlands_East_Indies_Army "Royal Netherlands East Indies Army"), having refused to disclose the location of a wanted Indonesian independence fighter, Lukas Kustaryo. Most estimates place the number at 431.

NAME: [Haifa Oil Refinery massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haifa_Oil_Refinery_massacre "Haifa Oil Refinery massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Irgun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irgun "Irgun") members throw bombs at a group of 100 Palestinian refinery workers, killing 6 and wounding 42. Palestinian workers then attack [Jewish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jewish "Jewish") refinery workers in retaliation, resulting in 39 deaths and 49 injuries,

NAME: [Balad al-Shaykh massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balad_al-Shaykh_massacre "Balad al-Shaykh massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Haganah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haganah "Haganah") attacks residents of Palestinian Balad al-Shaykh village, killing 21 while residents were asleep.

NAME: [Jeju massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeju_massacre "Jeju massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Brutal suppression of an uprising. Many Communist sympathizer civilians were killed by South Korean troops while putting down the rebellion. Between 14,000 and 60,000 people died during the uprising.

NAME: [Deir Yassin massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deir_Yassin_massacre "Deir Yassin massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Deir Yassin massacre took place when the Irgun and [Lehi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lehi_(militant_group) "Lehi (militant group)") militant groups attacked the Palestinian Arab village of Deir Yassin near Jerusalem, population of 750. Fatalities were estimated between 107-254 villagers, including civilian men, women, and children.

NAME: [Hadassah medical convoy massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hadassah_medical_convoy_massacre "Hadassah medical convoy massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Convoy, escorted by Haganah militia, bringing medical and fortification supplies and personnel to [Hadassah Hospital](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hadassah_Hospital "Hadassah Hospital") on Mount Scopus was ambushed by Arab forces. 78 Jews, mainly doctors and nurses, were killed in the ambush.

NAME: [Kfar Etzion massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kfar_Etzion_massacre "Kfar Etzion massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Arab armed forces attacked a Jewish kibbutz the day before the Declaration of Independence of the state of Israel

NAME: [Massacre in Lydda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1948_Palestinian_exodus_from_Lydda_and_Ramle#Massacre_in_Lydda "1948 Palestinian exodus from Lydda and Ramle") (Dahamsh Mosque massacre)
DESCRIPTION: Over 150 Palestinian civilians had taken shelter in the Dahamsh Mosque during the Israeli conquest of Lydda (today's Lod) when an Israeli soldier dug a hole in the wall of the mosque and shot an anti-tank shell through it. All were crushed against the walls by the pressure from the blast and killed. Also killed were 20 more after cleaning up the scene of the massacre. More civilians were killed as Israeli soldiers of the 89th Brigade, led by [Moshe Dayan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moshe_Dayan "Moshe Dayan"), throw grenades inside Palestinian houses, and those who fled to the streets were shot at by Israeli forces. Almost the entire population of Lydda, about 50,000 civilians at the time, which included many refugees, were then expelled and hundreds of men, women and children died due to dehydration, exhaustion and disease during a "death march" to the Arab front lines.

NAME: [Babrra massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babrra_massacre "Babrra massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Pakistani police and militia forces killed more than 600 unarmed Pashtuns, who were supporters of the Khudai Khidmatgar movement, and injured more than 1200 others on Babrra ground in the Hashtnagar region in Charsadda District, North-West Frontier Province (now Khyber Pakhtunkhwa), Pakistan.

NAME: [Al-Dawayima massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Dawayima_massacre "Al-Dawayima massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The killing of civilians by the [Israeli army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_army "Israeli army") (IDF) that took place in the Palestinian Arab town of al-Dawayima on during the [1948 Arab-Israeli War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1948_Arab%E2%80%93Israeli_War "1948 Arab-Israeli War").

NAME: [Safsaf massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Safsaf_massacre "Safsaf massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Israeli army (IDF) killed Palestinian civilians using two platoons of armored cars.

NAME: [Eilabun massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eilabun_massacre "Eilabun massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Israeli army kills 14 [Palestinian Christians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_Christian "Palestinian Christian") from the Eilaboun village, in north Israel, and expels the rest of the residents to [Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon "Lebanon"). Part of the community returns some months thereafter, due to pressure from the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations") and the [Vatican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_See "Holy See").

NAME: [Hula massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hula_massacre "Hula massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Hula is a Lebanese Shi'a Muslim village near the Lebanese [Litani River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Litani_River "Litani River"). It was captured by the Carmeli Brigade of the [Israel Defense Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces") without any resistance. 35-58 captured men were reportedly shot down in a house which was later blown up on top of them. Two officers were responsible for the massacre; one served a one-year prison sentence and later received presidential amnesty. Shmuel Lahis was later to become Director General of the [Jewish Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jewish_Agency "Jewish Agency").

NAME: [Batang Kali massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batang_Kali_massacre "Batang Kali massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Villagers were purportedly shot by British troops before the village was burnt.

NAME: [Rengat massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rengat_massacre "Rengat massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Part of [Operation Kraai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Kraai "Operation Kraai"), and the bodies were disposed in the [Indragiri River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indragiri_River "Indragiri River"), the deaths included the father of an author named [Chairil Anwar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chairil_Anwar "Chairil Anwar").

NAME: [Mungyeong massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mungyeong_massacre "Mungyeong massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Communist sympathizer civilians were killed by South Korean troops.

NAME: [Bodo League massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodo_League_massacre "Bodo League massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), communist sympathizer civilians or prisoners were killed by South Korean troops. Some scholars insist that the number of victims is between 100,000 and 200,000. The number claimed by the [2005 South Korean Truth and Reconciliation Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truth_and_Reconciliation_Commission_(South_Korea) "Truth and Reconciliation Commission (South Korea)") is 4,934.

NAME: [Seoul National University Hospital massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seoul_National_University_Hospital_massacre "Seoul National University Hospital massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), medical personnels, inpatients and wounded soldiers were killed by North Korean troops. There were 900 victims.

NAME: [No Gun Ri massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_Gun_Ri_massacre "No Gun Ri massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Early in the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), South Korean refugees trying to cross U.S. lines at [No Gun Ri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_Gun_Ri "No Gun Ri") were killed by U.S. troops fearing North Korean infiltrators. In 2005, the South Korean government certified the names of 150 dead, 13 missing and 55 wounded, some of whom died of wounds, and said reports on many more victims were not filed. The South Korean government-funded No Gun Ri Peace Foundation estimated in 2011 that 250-300 were killed, mostly women and children. Survivors estimated 400 dead.

NAME: [Hill 303 massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hill_303_massacre "Hill 303 massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), American POWs were massacred by [North Korean Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korean_Army "North Korean Army") on August 14, 1950.

NAME: [Namyangju massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Namyangju_massacre "Namyangju massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), South Korean citizens were massacred by [South Korean police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_South_Korea "Law enforcement in South Korea") between October 1950 and early 1951.

NAME: [Goyang Geumjeong Cave massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goyang_Geumjeong_Cave_massacre "Goyang Geumjeong Cave massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), South Korean civilians were massacred by [South Korean police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_South_Korea "Law enforcement in South Korea") between October 9 to October 31, 1950.

NAME: [Sinchon Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinchon_Massacre "Sinchon Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The North Korean government claims that North Korean citizens were massacred by [United States forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_forces "United States forces") between October 17 to December 7, 1950. This is widely disputed.

NAME: [Ganghwa massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ganghwa_massacre "Ganghwa massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), Communist collaborator civilians were massacred by [South Korean forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_forces_of_South_Korea "Armed forces of South Korea"), [South Korean Police forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_South_Korea "Law enforcement in South Korea") and pro-[South Korea forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_forces_of_South_Korea "Armed forces of South Korea") [militia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Militia "Militia").

NAME: [Sancheong and Hamyang massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sancheong_and_Hamyang_massacre "Sancheong and Hamyang massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), Communist sympathizer civilians were massacred by [South Korean Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korean_Army "South Korean Army") on February 7, 1951.

NAME: [Geochang massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geochang_massacre "Geochang massacre")
DESCRIPTION: During the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War"), Communist sympathizer civilians were massacred by [South Korean Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korean_Army "South Korean Army") between February 9 and February 11, 1951.

NAME: [Lari massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lari_massacre "Lari massacre")
DESCRIPTION: About 150 [Kikuyu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kikuyu_people "Kikuyu people") were killed by fellow tribesmen.

NAME: [Qibya massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qibya_massacre "Qibya massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Also known as the **Qibya incident**, occurred during "Operation Shoshana" when Israeli troops of [Unit 101](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit_101 "Unit 101") under [Ariel Sharon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariel_Sharon "Ariel Sharon") attacked the village of [Qibya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qibya "Qibya") in the [West Bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jordanian_annexation_of_the_West_Bank "Jordanian annexation of the West Bank"). At least sixty-nine [Palestinian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinians "Palestinians") villagers were killed, two-thirds of them women and children.

NAME: [Kafr Qasim massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kafr_Qasim_massacre "Kafr Qasim massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Israeli Border Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_Border_Police "Israeli Border Police") shoot Israeli Arab farmers returning to their village from work, unaware of a curfew imposed on it. The police command ordered that civilians caught disobeying the curfew be shot. Over half the casualties were women and children.

NAME: [Sharpeville massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sharpeville_massacre "Sharpeville massacre")
DESCRIPTION: South African police shot down black protesters.

NAME: [Mueda massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mueda_massacre "Mueda massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Makonde nationalists organized a demonstration in front of the Mueda District headquarters on the Mueda town square demanding independence from Portugal, apparently the district administrator had invited them to present their grievances. The administrator ordered the leaders arrested, and the crowd protested. The Portuguese administrator ordered his pre-assembled troops to fire on the crowd, and then many more were thrown to their death into a [ravine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ravine "Ravine"). The number of dead is in dispute. However, resentment generated by these events led ultimately to independentist guerrilla [FRELIMO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FRELIMO "FRELIMO") gaining needed momentum in the outset of the [Mozambican War of Independence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mozambican_War_of_Independence "Mozambican War of Independence").

NAME: [Paris massacre of 1961](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_massacre_of_1961 "Paris massacre of 1961")
DESCRIPTION: French police, commanded by [Maurice Papon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maurice_Papon "Maurice Papon"), crushed a pacific demonstration of [Algerians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algeria "Algeria") independentists.

NAME: [Novocherkassk massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Novocherkassk_massacre "Novocherkassk massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The [MVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MVD "MVD") open fire on a crowd of protesters demonstrating against inflation.

NAME: [Oran massacre of 1962](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oran_massacre_of_1962 "Oran massacre of 1962")
DESCRIPTION: Massacre of civilians including Europeans by an angry mob at the end of the [Algerian War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algerian_War "Algerian War") (1954-62).

NAME: [Liborista massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palma_Sola_massacre "Palma Sola massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Dominican military dropped napalm on the Liboristas from airplanes-burning six hundred people to death.

NAME: [Jérémie Vespers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J%C3%A9r%C3%A9mie_Vespers "Jérémie Vespers")
DESCRIPTION: In 1964, a group of exiled opponents of the [François Duvalier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fran%C3%A7ois_Duvalier "François Duvalier") regime called "[Jeune Haiti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeune_Haiti "Jeune Haiti")" landed in Haiti to try to overthrow Duvalier, which ended in failure. Because many of those who participated in the overthrowing were originally from the city of [Jérémie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J%C3%A9r%C3%A9mie "Jérémie"), the government ordered reprisals against their relatives, so the army and other elements of the Duvalier regime entered the city and killed 27 people.

NAME: [Indonesian massacres of 1965-1966](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesian_mass_killings_of_1965%E2%80%931966 "Indonesian mass killings of 1965-1966")
DESCRIPTION: Massacre of those accused of being communists in Indonesia.

NAME: [University of Texas massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Texas_massacre "University of Texas massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [University of Texas at Austin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Texas_at_Austin "University of Texas at Austin") was the site of a massacre by [Charles Whitman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Whitman "Charles Whitman"), who killed his mother and wife at their homes before killing 15 and wounding 32 others at the University atop the university tower before the police killed him.

LOCATION: Binh Tai village in [Phước Bình District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ph%C6%B0%E1%BB%9Bc_B%C3%ACnh_District "Phước Bình District") of [Sông Bé Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%B4ng_B%C3%A9_Province "Sông Bé Province"), [South Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Vietnam "South Vietnam")
NAME: [Binh Tai Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binh_Tai_Massacre "Binh Tai Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: South Korean soldiers purportedly killed 68 South Vietnamese villagers.

LOCATION: Binh Hoa village in [Quảng Ngãi Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qu%E1%BA%A3ng_Ng%C3%A3i_Province "Quảng Ngãi Province"), [South Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Vietnam "South Vietnam")
NAME: [Bình Hòa massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B%C3%ACnh_H%C3%B2a_massacre "Bình Hòa massacre")
DESCRIPTION: South Korean soldiers purportedly killed South Vietnamese villagers.

NAME: [Asaba massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asaba_massacre "Asaba massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Igbo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Igbo_people "Igbo people") civilians are killed by the Nigerian 2nd Division commanded by [Murtala Mohammed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murtala_Mohammed "Murtala Mohammed"), during the [Nigerian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigerian_Civil_War "Nigerian Civil War").

NAME: [Massacre at Huế](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massacre_at_Hu%E1%BA%BF "Massacre at Huế")
DESCRIPTION: During the 1968 [Tet Offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tet_Offensive "Tet Offensive") in the [Vietnam War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam_War "Vietnam War"), unarmed South Vietnamese civilians were massacred by [North Vietnamese Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Vietnamese_Army "North Vietnamese Army") and [Vietcong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietcong "Vietcong"). Numerous [mass graves](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_grave "Mass grave") were discovered in and around Huế after the Offensive. Victims included women, men, children, and infants. Estimated death toll was between 2,800 and 6,000 [civilians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civilian "Civilian") and [POWs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoners_of_war "Prisoners of war"). The [Republic of Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Vietnam "South Vietnam") released a list of 4,062 victims identified as having been either murdered or abducted. Victims were found bound, tortured, and often [buried alive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premature_burial "Premature burial"). Many victims were also clubbed to death.

NAME: [Jabidah massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jabidah_massacre "Jabidah massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Jabidah massacre was the killing of [Moro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moro_people "Moro people") soldiers by members of the [Armed Forces of the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_the_Philippines "Armed Forces of the Philippines") (AFP) on March 18, 1968.

LOCATION: Phong Nhi and Phong Nhat hamlets,[Dien Ban District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dien_Ban_District "Dien Ban District") of [Quảng Nam Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qu%E1%BA%A3ng_Nam_Province "Quảng Nam Province"), [South Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Vietnam "South Vietnam")
NAME: [Phong Nhi and Phong Nhat massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phong_Nhi_and_Phong_Nhat_massacre "Phong Nhi and Phong Nhat massacre")
DESCRIPTION: South Korean soldiers killed unarmed South Vietnamese villagers.

LOCATION: Hà My village, [Quảng Nam Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qu%E1%BA%A3ng_Nam_Province "Quảng Nam Province"), [South Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Vietnam "South Vietnam")
NAME: [Hà My massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H%C3%A0_My_massacre "Hà My massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [South Korean soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korean_soldier "South Korean soldier") purportedly killed unarmed South Vietnamese villagers.

LOCATION: Mỹ Lai and Mỹ Khê hamlets,[Sơn Mỹ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C6%A1n_M%E1%BB%B9 "Sơn Mỹ"), Quảng Ngãi, [South Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Vietnam "South Vietnam")
NAME: [My Lai Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Lai_Massacre "My Lai Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: U.S. soldiers murdered, tortured and assaulted 347-504 unarmed South Vietnamese villagers suspected of aiding the [Vietcong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietcong "Vietcong"), ranging in ages from 1-81 years, mostly women and children.

NAME: [Tlatelolco massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tlatelolco_massacre "Tlatelolco massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Government troops massacred between 25 (officially) and 250 (according to human rights activists, CIA documents and independent investigations) students 10 days before the [1968 Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1968_Summer_Olympics "1968 Summer Olympics") taking place in Mexico City, and then tried to wash the blood away, along with evidence of the massacre.

NAME: [Kent State massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kent_State_massacre "Kent State massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 29 members of the Ohio National Guard opened fire on unarmed students protesting the expansion of the Vietnam War into Cambodia on the Kent State University college campus, killing 4 and wounding 9, one of whom was permanently paralyzed.

NAME: [Ketnar Bil massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ketnar_Bil_massacre "Ketnar Bil massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Massacre of unarmed [Bengali Hindus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bengali_Hindu "Bengali Hindu") in Ketnar Bil region of Barisal District by the Pakistan Army.

NAME: [Corpus Christi massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corpus_Christi_massacre "Corpus Christi massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Similar to the Tlatelolco Massacre, the Corpus Christi Massacre took place on Thursday, June 10, 1971 when a student march got brutally attacked by a shock group called Los Halcones.

NAME: [Bogside massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bogside_massacre "Bogside massacre") (31 January 1972)
DESCRIPTION: [British paratroopers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parachute_Regiment_(United_Kingdom) "Parachute Regiment (United Kingdom)") fired on unarmed civil rights protesters, killing 14. The government sponsored [Saville Report](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloody_Sunday_Inquiry "Bloody Sunday Inquiry"), released in June 2010, found all those killed were innocent civil rights demonstrators, prompting an apology by UK Prime Minister [David Cameron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Cameron "David Cameron"). As of that time, no one had been prosecuted for the killings.

NAME: [Lod Airport massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lod_Airport_massacre "Lod Airport massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Three members of the [Japanese Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Red_Army "Japanese Red Army"), on behalf of the [Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popular_Front_for_the_Liberation_of_Palestine "Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine"), killed 26 people and injured 80 others at [Tel Aviv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tel_Aviv "Tel Aviv")'s [Lod](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lod "Lod") airport (now [Ben Gurion International Airport](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Gurion_International_Airport "Ben Gurion International Airport")).

NAME: [Munich massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Munich_massacre "Munich massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Members of the [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel "Israel") Olympic team were taken hostage and killed by the Palestinian [Black September](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_September_(group) "Black September (group)") group. A West German police officer was also killed.

NAME: [Ezeiza massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ezeiza_massacre "Ezeiza massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Members of the right wing of the [Peronist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peronism "Peronism") party shot and killed at least 13 after [Peron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peron "Peron")'s return to Argentina.

NAME: [Battle of Jolo (1974)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Jolo_(1974) "Battle of Jolo (1974)")
DESCRIPTION: Soldiers of the [Armed Forces of the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_the_Philippines "Armed Forces of the Philippines") looted and burned the southern Philippine town of [Jolo, Sulu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jolo,_Sulu "Jolo, Sulu") and killed many of its [Muslim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muslim "Muslim") [Tausug](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tausug_people "Tausug people") inhabitants while leaving many more homeless after an engagement with the [Moro rebels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moro_National_Liberation_Front "Moro National Liberation Front").

NAME: [Ma'alot massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ma%27alot_massacre "Ma'alot massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Members of the [Democratic Front for the Liberation of Palestine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Front_for_the_Liberation_of_Palestine "Democratic Front for the Liberation of Palestine") infiltrate Israel from Lebanon, shoot and kill a Christian Arab woman and a Jewish couple and their 4-year-old son, and then take hostage and kill 22 high school students and three of their adult escorts.

NAME: [Maratha, Santalaris and Aloda massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maratha,_Santalaris_and_Aloda_massacre "Maratha, Santalaris and Aloda massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [EOKA-B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EOKA-B "EOKA-B") gunmen massacred the Turkish Cypriot inhabitants of the villages of Maratha, Santalaris and Aloda.

NAME: [Tochni massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tochni_massacre "Tochni massacre")
DESCRIPTION: EOKA-B gunmen massacred the Turkish Cypriot inhabitants of the Tochni.

NAME: [Malisbong Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malisbong_Massacre "Malisbong Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Soldiers of the [Armed Forces of the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_the_Philippines "Armed Forces of the Philippines") murdered male [Muslim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muslim "Muslim") [Moros](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moro_people "Moro people") aged 11-70 years old in a village surrounding a nearby mosque.

NAME: [Miami Showband massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miami_Showband_massacre "Miami Showband massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Members of the [Ulster Volunteer Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulster_Volunteer_Force_(1966) "Ulster Volunteer Force (1966)") (UVF) with backing from the [British Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Army "British Army") forces killed three members of pop group the Miami Showband in a gun and bomb attack. Two UVF members also died when the bomb exploded prematurely.

NAME: [Kingsmill massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingsmill_massacre "Kingsmill massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Irish republicans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irish_republicans "Irish republicans") shot ten Protestant workers dead outside the village of Kingsmill in [County Armagh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/County_Armagh "County Armagh"), [Northern Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Ireland "Northern Ireland").

NAME: [Karantina massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karantina_massacre "Karantina massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Lebanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon "Lebanon") Christian militia overrun the Karantina district in East Beirut and kill up to 1,500 Palestinians and Muslims during the [Lebanese Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_Civil_War "Lebanese Civil War").

NAME: [Damour massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Damour_massacre "Damour massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Palestinian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_people "Palestinian people") militia aligned with the [Lebanese National Movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_National_Movement "Lebanese National Movement") kill 150-582 Christian civilians in the village of [Damour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Damour "Damour") during the [Lebanese Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_Civil_War "Lebanese Civil War"), in retaliation for the Karantina massacre.

NAME: [Soweto massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soweto_uprising "Soweto uprising")
DESCRIPTION: The [South African Police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_African_Police "South African Police") shoot a group of young black protesters who were protesting.

NAME: [Letipea massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letipea_massacre "Letipea massacre")
DESCRIPTION: A conflict between workers and drunken [Soviet border guards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Border_Troops "Soviet Border Troops") escalated when one of the guards opened fire with a [machine gun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machine_gun "Machine gun"), killing multiple workers as well as one of his fellow guards.

NAME: [Tel al-Zaatar massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tel_al-Zaatar_massacre "Tel al-Zaatar massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Lebanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanon "Lebanon") Christian militias enter the Tel al-Zaatar refugee camp and kill up to 3,000 people during the [Lebanese Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_Civil_War "Lebanese Civil War").

NAME: [6 October 1976 massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/6_October_1976_massacre "6 October 1976 massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Right-wing authorities and right-wing anti-communism/ people defending the monarchy surrounded Thammasat University and killed 40 or more protesters.

NAME: [Golden Dragon massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Dragon_massacre "Golden Dragon massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Five members of a Chinese-American gang called the Joe Boys attempt to kill leaders of a rival gang called the [Wah Ching](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wah_Ching "Wah Ching"). Their attack on the Golden Dragon restaurant kills 5 people and wounds another 11, none of them gang members.

NAME: [Aztra massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aztra_massacre "Aztra massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Workers from the Aztra [ingenio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engenho "Engenho") who were on strike are assassinated by the [National Police of Ecuador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Police_of_Ecuador "National Police of Ecuador").

NAME: [Coastal Road massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coastal_Road_massacre "Coastal Road massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Palestinian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_people "Palestinian people") [Fatah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatah "Fatah") members based in Lebanon land on a beach north of [Tel Aviv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tel_Aviv "Tel Aviv"), kill an American photographer, and hijack an inter-city bus driving along [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel "Israel")'s [Coastal Highway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Highway_2_(Israel) "Highway 2 (Israel)"). 35 civilians are killed and 80 wounded.

NAME: [Marichjhapi massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marichjhapi_massacre "Marichjhapi massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Marichjhapi massacre refers to the forcible eviction of Bangladeshi refugees and their subsequent death by starvation, exhaustion and police firing in the period between January-June, 1979.

NAME: [Greensboro massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greensboro_massacre "Greensboro massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Members of the [Ku Klux Klan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan "Ku Klux Klan") and the [American Nazi Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Nazi_Party "American Nazi Party") assassinate 5 members of the [Communist Workers' Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communist_Workers%27_Party_(United_States) "Communist Workers' Party (United States)") who were protesting.

NAME: [Gwangju massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gwangju_massacre "Gwangju massacre")
DESCRIPTION: An escalated popular uprising in the city of [Gwangju](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gwangju "Gwangju"), [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea") during which some of the civilian protesters armed themselves by raiding police stations and military depots led to the South Korean army violently ending the protests, causing 165 (maximum estimated) of deaths (including 24 soldiers, 4 policemen).

NAME: [Tadmor Prison massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tadmor_Prison_massacre "Tadmor Prison massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The massacre occurred the day after a failed attempt to assassinate [Syrian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria "Syria") president [Hafez el-Assad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hafez_el-Assad "Hafez el-Assad"). Members of the units of the [Defence Brigades](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defence_Brigades "Defence Brigades"), under the command of [Rifaat El Assad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rifaat_El_Assad "Rifaat El Assad"), brother of the president, entered in [Tadmor Prison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tadmor_Prison "Tadmor Prison") and assassinated about a thousand prisoners in the cells and the dormitories.

NAME: [El Mozote massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Mozote_massacre "El Mozote massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The El Mozote Massacre took place in the village of [El Mozote](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Mozote "El Mozote"), in [Morazán department](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moraz%C3%A1n_department "Morazán department"), [El Salvador](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Salvador "El Salvador"), on December 11, 1981, when [Salvadoran armed forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvadoran_armed_forces "Salvadoran armed forces") trained by the [United States military](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_military "United States military") killed at least 1,000 civilians in an anti-[guerrilla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guerrilla "Guerrilla") campaign.

NAME: [Tula massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tula_massacre "Tula massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 13 tortured bodies were found at Tula, Hidalgo, Mexico at the time of Arturo Durazo Moreno Administration.

NAME: [Hama massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hama_massacre "Hama massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The [Syrian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_Army "Syrian Army") killed an estimated 30,000 people in the city of [Hama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hama "Hama"). Instances of mass execution and torture by the Syrian military were documented during the attacks.

NAME: [Sabra and Shatila massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabra_and_Shatila_massacre "Sabra and Shatila massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Residents of Sabra and Shatila, mostly Palestinian refugees and Lebanese Shia, are killed by the Christian [Lebanese Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebanese_Forces "Lebanese Forces") militia in the refugee camps, with the help of Israeli forces that encircled the area. The [United Nations General Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly "United Nations General Assembly") condemned the massacre and declared it to be an act of [genocide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").

NAME: [Dos Erres Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dos_Erres_massacre "Dos Erres massacre")
DESCRIPTION: US-trained Guatemalan, elite forces came to the village and claimed the village were hiding weapons from rebels. They searched the entire village but they could not find any weapons. The next day, these soldiers massacred everyone in the village. There were only 3 survivors.

NAME: [Wah Mee massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wah_Mee_massacre "Wah Mee massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Three Chinese-American gangsters bind, rob, and shoot 14 people in the Wah Mee gambling club at the Louisa Hotel, 13 of whom die.

NAME: [Lucanamarca massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucanamarca_massacre "Lucanamarca massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Maoist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maoist "Maoist") [Shining Path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shining_Path "Shining Path") guerrillas massacre 69 men, women and children with axes, machetes and guns in and around the town of Lucanamarca, Peru.

NAME: [Wagalla massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wagalla_massacre "Wagalla massacre")
DESCRIPTION: a massacre of ethnic [Somalis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalis "Somalis") by Kenyan security forces who first gathered them at the [Wagalla Airstrip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wagalla_Airstrip "Wagalla Airstrip"), [Wajir County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wajir_County "Wajir County"), Kenya.

NAME: [San Ysidro McDonald's massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Ysidro_McDonald%27s_massacre "San Ysidro McDonald's massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Gunman James Oliver Huberty killed 21 people in a [McDonald's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McDonald%27s "McDonald's") restaurant before being fatally shot by a [SWAT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SWAT "SWAT") team sniper.

NAME: [1984 Sikh massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1984_Sikh_massacre "1984 Sikh massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Mobs composed primarily of Indian National Congress workers and local hoodlums chase down and lynch Sikhs in northern India following the assassination of India PM, Indira Gandhi, at the hands of her Sikh guards.

NAME: [Dujail Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dujail_Massacre "Dujail Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Dujail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dujail "Dujail") was the site of an unsuccessful [assassination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination "Assassination") attempt against then [Iraqi president](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Iraq "President of Iraq"), [Saddam Hussein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saddam_Hussein "Saddam Hussein") by the Shiite [Dawa Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dawa_Party "Dawa Party"), on July 8, 1982. Saddam Hussein ordered his special security and military forces to arrest all Dawa members and their families, imprisoning 787 men, women and children. In March 1985, 96 of the 148 who had confessed to having taken part in the assassination attempt were executed.

NAME: [Anuradhapura massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anuradhapura_massacre "Anuradhapura massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Tamil Tiger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LTTE "LTTE") gunmen shot dead 146 Sinhalese civilians including [Buddhist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddhist "Buddhist") [nuns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nun "Nun") and [monks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monk "Monk") and injured 85 others as they were praying at [Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaya_Sri_Maha_Bodhi "Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi"), a sacred Buddhist [shrine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shrine "Shrine") in [Anuradhapura](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anuradhapura "Anuradhapura").

NAME: [Accomarca massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accomarca_massacre "Accomarca massacre")
DESCRIPTION: An army massacre of campesinos (including six children) in Accomarca, Ayacucho.

NAME: [Lieyu massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1987_Lieyu_massacre "1987 Lieyu massacre") ([Donggang Incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donggang_Incident "Donggang Incident"))
DESCRIPTION: [Republic of China Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_China_Army "Republic of China Army") executed all the unarmed [Vietnamese refugees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnamese_boat_people "Vietnamese boat people") in a disoriented [fishing boat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fishing_boat "Fishing boat") seeking for [political asylum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_asylum "Political asylum") at Donggang beach of [Lieyu, Kinmen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lieyu,_Kinmen "Lieyu, Kinmen") on March 7-8, 1987.

NAME: [Aranthalawa Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aranthalawa_Massacre "Aranthalawa Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Tamil Tigers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LTTE "LTTE") stopped a bus carrying [Buddhist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddhist "Buddhist") [monks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monk "Monk") in Arantalawa and massacred all except of one monk. Killed in the massacre are Chief Priest Ven. Hegoda Indrasara and several novice monks (under the age of 18)

NAME: [Pınarcık massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P%C4%B1narc%C4%B1k_massacre "Pınarcık massacre")
DESCRIPTION: On 20 June 1987, [PKK](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurdistan_Workers%27_Party "Kurdistan Workers' Party") committed a massacre in the village of Pınarcık in the [Mardin Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mardin_Province "Mardin Province") of [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey "Turkey"), killing more than 30 people, mainly women and children.

NAME: [Hoddle Street massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoddle_Street_massacre "Hoddle Street massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Hoddle Street massacre was a [killing spree](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spree_killing "Spree killing") which claimed the lives of 7 people and wounded 19 others at [Hoddle Street](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoddle_Highway "Hoddle Highway") in [Clifton Hill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clifton_Hill,_Victoria "Clifton Hill, Victoria") in north-eastern [Melbourne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melbourne "Melbourne"), [Victoria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria_(Australia) "Victoria (Australia)"), Australia.

NAME: [Hungerford massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungerford_massacre "Hungerford massacre")
DESCRIPTION: A gunman armed with [semi-automatic rifles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semi-automatic_rifle "Semi-automatic rifle") and a [handgun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handgun "Handgun") killed 16 people before committing suicide.

NAME: [Remembrance Day bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remembrance_Day_bombing "Remembrance Day bombing") (Poppy Day massacre).
DESCRIPTION: Provisional IRA bombing at the town's cenotaph on [Remembrance Sunday](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remembrance_Sunday "Remembrance Sunday").

NAME: [Queen Street massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_Street_massacre "Queen Street massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Queen Street massacre was a [killing spree](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spree_killing "Spree killing") which claimed the lives of 8 people and wounded 5 others in [Melbourne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melbourne "Melbourne"), [Victoria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria_(Australia) "Victoria (Australia)"), Australia.

NAME: [Milltown massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milltown_massacre "Milltown massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Ulster Defence Association](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulster_Defence_Association "Ulster Defence Association") (UDA) member [Michael Stone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Stone_(loyalist_paramilitary) "Michael Stone (loyalist paramilitary)") kills three people and injures 60 others in a gun and grenade attack at the funeral of three IRA members being held in [Milltown Cemetery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milltown_Cemetery "Milltown Cemetery"), [Belfast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belfast "Belfast").

NAME: [Tiananmen Square protests of 1989](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiananmen_Square_protests_of_1989 "Tiananmen Square protests of 1989")
DESCRIPTION: The mourning of [Hu Yaobang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hu_Yaobang "Hu Yaobang") eventually evolved into a large-scale anti-corruption and democratic demonstration, which was ended in a violent suppression by [state-controlled army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army "People's Liberation Army"). The actual number of deaths is still unknown. The massacre did not occur within Tiananmen Square, but in the surrounding areas of the square.

NAME: [Albrook Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1989_Panamanian_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat_attempt#Albrook_massacre_and_arrests "1989 Panamanian coup d'état attempt")
DESCRIPTION: Following a failed coup, 12 officers were shot dead by forces loyal to Panamanian leader [Manuel Noriega](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manuel_Noriega "Manuel Noriega").

NAME: [École Polytechnique massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89cole_Polytechnique_massacre "École Polytechnique massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Marc Lépine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marc_L%C3%A9pine "Marc Lépine"), a misogynist and anti-feminist, shot and killed 14 female students of the École Polytechnique de Montréal and wounded 14 other people before turning his gun on himself. The event led to stricter gun control laws and changes in police tactical response to shootings in Canada.

NAME: [Eastern University massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_University_massacre "Eastern University massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Eastern University massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_University_massacre "Eastern University massacre") is the massacre of 158 minority [Sri Lankan Tamil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lankan_Tamil "Sri Lankan Tamil") civilians by the [Sri Lankan Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lankan_Army "Sri Lankan Army") in the eastern [Batticaloa District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batticaloa_District "Batticaloa District"), [Sri Lanka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lanka "Sri Lanka").

NAME: [Gawkadal massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gawkadal_massacre "Gawkadal massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Indian paramilitary troops of the [Central Reserve Police Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Reserve_Police_Force "Central Reserve Police Force") opened fire on Kashmiri protesters.

NAME: [Monrovia Church massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monrovia_Church_massacre "Monrovia Church massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Around 30 [government soldiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_Liberia "Armed Forces of Liberia") loyal to [Samuel Doe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Doe "Samuel Doe") and belonging to his [Krahn tribe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Krahn_people "Krahn people") entered St. Peter's Lutheran Church, indiscriminately slaughtering the mostly [Gio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dan_people "Dan people") and [Mano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mano_people "Mano people") people inside.

NAME: [Sathurukondan massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sathurukondan_massacre "Sathurukondan massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Sathurukondan massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sathurukondan_massacre "Sathurukondan massacre"), also known as the [1990 Batticaloa massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1990_Batticaloa_massacre "1990 Batticaloa massacre") is the massacre of 184 minority [Sri Lankan Tamil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lankan_Tamil "Sri Lankan Tamil") civilians by the [Sri Lankan Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lankan_Army "Sri Lankan Army") in the eastern [Batticaloa District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batticaloa_District "Batticaloa District"), [Sri Lanka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lanka "Sri Lanka").

NAME: [Aramoana massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aramoana_massacre "Aramoana massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Lone gunman David Malcolm Gray began shooting indiscriminately at people, killing 13 people before being killed by police himself, allegedly after a dispute with his next door neighbor. It remains New Zealand's deadliest criminal shooting.

NAME: [Dilla Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dilla_Massacre "Dilla Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Dilla Massacre, was a series of events that spanned from January 1991 to March 1991, perpetrated by members of the [Somali National Movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somali_National_Movement "Somali National Movement") (SNM) rebel group, against the [Gadabuursi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gadabuursi "Gadabuursi") clan. The most violent episode was on February 4, 1991 in Dilla, Awdal where hundreds of people were murdered within a single day. The killings were referred to and classified as [ethnic cleansing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing "Ethnic cleansing"), against the Gadabursi, by the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations").

NAME: [Luby's shooting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luby%27s_shooting "Luby's shooting")
DESCRIPTION: George Jo Hennard drove his pickup truck into a Luby's Cafeteria and shot and killed 22 people, wounded another 20 and then committed suicide by shooting himself.

NAME: [Barrios Altos massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barrios_Altos_massacre "Barrios Altos massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Fifteen people were killed and four injured when [Grupo Colina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grupo_Colina "Grupo Colina"), the anti-communist paramilitary squad, opened fire on a neighborhood barbecue which they had mistaken for a gathering of [Maoist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maoist "Maoist") [Shining Path](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shining_Path "Shining Path") rebels.

NAME: [Santa Cruz massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santa_Cruz_massacre "Santa Cruz massacre")
DESCRIPTION: An estimated 270 pro-independence demonstrators were killed in the Santa Cruz Cemetery while conducting a peaceful memorial service during the [Indonesian Occupation of East Timor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesian_Occupation_of_East_Timor "Indonesian Occupation of East Timor") and is part of the [East Timorese Genocide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Timorese_Genocide "East Timorese Genocide").

NAME: [Bor massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bor_massacre "Bor massacre")
DESCRIPTION: An estimated 2,000 civilians were massacred in [Bor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bor,_South_Sudan "Bor, South Sudan") during the [Second Sudanese Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Sudanese_Civil_War "Second Sudanese Civil War") by [Nuer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuer_people "Nuer people") fighters from [SPLA-Nasir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SPLA-Nasir "SPLA-Nasir"), led by [Riek Machar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riek_Machar "Riek Machar"), and the militant group known as the [Nuer White Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuer_White_Army "Nuer White Army").

NAME: [Vukovar massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vukovar_massacre "Vukovar massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Members of the Serb [militias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Militia "Militia"), aided by the [Yugoslav People's Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslav_People%27s_Army "Yugoslav People's Army"), killed Croat civilians and [POWs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/POW "POW").

NAME: [Bara massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bara_massacre "Bara massacre")
DESCRIPTION: An armed group of the [Maoist Communist Centre of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maoist_Communist_Centre_of_India "Maoist Communist Centre of India") containing members of [schedule castes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scheduled_Castes_and_Scheduled_Tribes "Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes") and [OBCs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Other_Backward_Class "Other Backward Class") killed a large group of [Bhumihar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhumihar "Bhumihar") men.

NAME: [Khojaly Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khojaly_Massacre "Khojaly Massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Armenian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armenia "Armenia") armed forces, reportedly with help of the Russian 366th Motor Rifle Regiment, raided the town of [Khojaly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khojali_(city) "Khojali (city)") and massacred its Muslim civilian population. The death toll according to the [Government of Azerbaijan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_Azerbaijan "Government of Azerbaijan") was 613 civilians, of whom 106 were women and 83 were children.

NAME: [Maraga massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maraga_massacre "Maraga massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Armenian inhabitants of village were killed by [Azerbaijani Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azerbaijani_Armed_Forces "Azerbaijani Armed Forces").

NAME: [Boipatong massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boipatong_massacre "Boipatong massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 45 [African National Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/African_National_Congress "African National Congress") (ANC) supporters were killed by members of the [Inkatha Freedom Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inkatha_Freedom_Party "Inkatha Freedom Party") (IFP).

NAME: [La Cantuta massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Cantuta_massacre "La Cantuta massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 9 students and a professor on [La Cantuta University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Cantuta_University "La Cantuta University") were kidnapped and killed by [Grupo Colina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grupo_Colina "Grupo Colina"), an anticommunist paramilitary group.

NAME: [Bisho massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bisho_massacre "Bisho massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 28 [African National Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/African_National_Congress "African National Congress") (ANC) supporters and one soldier were shot dead by the Ciskei Defence Force during a protest march.

NAME: [Carandiru massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carandiru_massacre "Carandiru massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The massacre was triggered by a prisoner revolt within the prison. The police made little if any effort to negotiate with the prisoners before the military police stormed the building, as the prison riot became more difficult for prison guards to control. The resulting casualties were of 111 prisoners killed.

NAME: [Brown's Chicken massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brown%27s_Chicken_massacre "Brown's Chicken massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Seven people were murdered at the Brown's Chicken and Pasta in Palatine

NAME: [Sukhumi massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukhumi_massacre "Sukhumi massacre") (1993)
DESCRIPTION:
Incidents of [ethnic cleansing of Georgians in Abkhazia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing_of_Georgians_in_Abkhazia "Ethnic cleansing of Georgians in Abkhazia"),
 also known as the "massacres of Georgians in Abkhazia" and "genocide of Georgians in Abkhazia"-refers to [ethnic cleansing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing "Ethnic cleansing"), massacres and forced mass expulsion of thousands of ethnic [Georgians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgian_people "Georgian people").

NAME: [Massacre at Waco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waco_massacre "Waco massacre") (July 1993)Davidian Massacre (1995)
DESCRIPTION: Seventy-six members of the [Branch Davidian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Branch_Davidian "Branch Davidian") church died after a [51-day siege](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waco_Siege "Waco Siege") in a fire started either accidentally or by church members after a [Federal Bureau of Investigation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation "Federal Bureau of Investigation") tank attack upon the main building. Earlier, on February 28, 1993, six others died by gunfire after the original [Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bureau_of_Alcohol,_Tobacco_and_Firearms "Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms") raid.

NAME: Yanomami or [Haximu massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haximu_massacre "Haximu massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Garimpeiros (illegal gold miners) killed [Yanomami](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yanomami "Yanomami") people.

NAME: [Sivas massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sivas_massacre "Sivas massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 35 people (mostly [Alevi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alevi "Alevi") intellectuals) were killed when a mob of Islamic extremists set fire to the hotel where the group had assembled.

NAME: [Başbağlar massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ba%C5%9Fba%C4%9Flar_massacre "Başbağlar massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Several [PKK](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurdistan_Workers%27_Party "Kurdistan Workers' Party") members stormed the village and killed 33 civilians after rounding them up. Also over 200 houses, a clinic, a school and a mosque were burned down.

NAME: [St James Church massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St_James_Church_massacre "St James Church massacre")
DESCRIPTION: 11 People were killed during a church service by [Azanian People's Liberation Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azanian_People%27s_Liberation_Army "Azanian People's Liberation Army") (APLA) armed with assault rifles and grenades.

NAME: [Greysteel massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greysteel_massacre "Greysteel massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Ulster Defence Association](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulster_Defence_Association "Ulster Defence Association") (UDA) opened fire in a crowded bar using an [AK-47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AK-47 "AK-47") and [automatic pistol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semi-automatic_pistol "Semi-automatic pistol"). Eight civilians were killed and thirteen wounded.

NAME: [Cave of the Patriarchs massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cave_of_the_Patriarchs_massacre "Cave of the Patriarchs massacre")(Ibrahimi Mosque massacre)
DESCRIPTION: Israeli settler [Baruch Goldstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baruch_Goldstein "Baruch Goldstein") opens fire with an assault rifle against Palestinian [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muslims "Muslims"), killing 29 and wounding 150 at prayer in the Ibrahimi Mosque in Hebron before being subdued and beaten to death by survivors.

NAME: [Algerian Village massacres of the 1990s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Algerian_massacres_of_the_1990s "List of Algerian massacres of the 1990s")
DESCRIPTION: During the 1990s, many [large-scale massacres of villagers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algerian_Civil_War#Village_massacres "Algerian Civil War") in Algeria were perpetrated by groups attacking villages at night and cutting the throats of the inhabitants. The [Armed Islamic Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Islamic_Group "Armed Islamic Group") (GIA) has avowed its responsibility for many of them. The massacres peaked in 1997 (with a smaller peak in 1994). According to a few reports former Algerian army officer, Habib Souaidia testified to his government's involvement in the massacres. The differing accounts are not yet reconciled. The academic consensus is that at least the majority of the massacres were carried out by Islamist radicals; however, the government notably failed to intervene in a number of these massacres.

NAME: [Shell House massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shell_House_massacre "Shell House massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Security guards of the [African National Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/African_National_Congress "African National Congress") (ANC) fired on 20,000 [Inkatha Freedom Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inkatha_Freedom_Party "Inkatha Freedom Party") (IFP) marchers.

NAME: [Raboteau massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raboteau_massacre "Raboteau massacre")
DESCRIPTION: Military and paramilitary forces loyal to the coup leader [Raoul Cédras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raoul_C%C3%A9dras "Raoul Cédras") carried out an incursion in the Raboteau neighborhood, in [Gonaïves](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gona%C3%AFves "Gonaïves"), after its inhabitants demonstrated in support of the ousted president [Jean-Bertrand Aristide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Bertrand_Aristide "Jean-Bertrand Aristide"). The inhabitants of Raboteau were beaten, arrested and later shot.

NAME: [Loughinisland massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loughinisland_massacre "Loughinisland massacre")
DESCRIPTION: [Ulster Volunteer Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulster_Volunteer_Force_(1966) "Ulster Volunteer Force (1966)") (UVF) opened fire in a crowded bar using [assault rifles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assault_rifle "Assault rifle"), killing six civilians and wounding five.

NAME: [Beit Lid massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beit_Lid_massacre "Beit Lid massacre")
DESCRIPTION: First [suicide attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide_attack "Suicide attack") by [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad"), killing 22 and wounding 69. Carried out by two bombers; the second waited until emergency crews arrived to assist the wounded and dying before detonating his bomb.

NAME: [Srebrenica massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Srebrenica_massacre "Srebrenica massacre")
DESCRIPTION: The Srebrenica massacre involved the genocidal killing, in July 1995, of 8,372 [Bosniaks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bosniaks "Bosniaks"), mainly men and boys, in and around the town of Srebrenica during the Bosnian War.

NAME: [Dunblane massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dunblane_massacre "Dunblane massacre")
DESCRIPTION: A gunman opened fire in a primary school, killing sixteen children and one teacher before killing himself.

NAME: [Port Arthur massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_Arthur_massacre_(Australia) "Port Arthur massacre (Australia)")
DESCRIPTION: The Port Arthur massacre of 28 April 1996 was a [killing spree](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spree_killing "Spree killing") which claimed the lives of 35 people and wounded 21 others mainly at the historic tourist site [Port Arthur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_Arthur,_Tasmania "Port Arthur, Tasmania") in south-eastern [Tasmania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tasmania "Tasmania"), Australia. It later emerged that the gunman had severe [intellectual disability](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intellectual_disability "Intellectual disability"). The massacre remains Australia's deadliest mass killing spree and remains one of the [deadliest such incidents worldwide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spree_killer "Spree killer") in recent times.

NAME: [First Qana massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1996_shelling_of_Qana "1996 shelling of Qana")
DESCRIPTION: [Israeli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_Defense_Forces "Israeli Defense Forces") artillery struck the [Unifil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unifil "Unifil") Headquarters in [Qana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qana "Qana") which was providing shelter to approximately two hundred [Lebanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demographics_of_Lebanon "Demographics of Lebanon") civilians. The Israeli military said the strike was in error and that they were not targeting the UN shelter.
